ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] ugh, shutting bards out of lotto getting more wides pread
ygData.msgSnippet: Sure, after all, casters all have meditate so why do they need your song? ... http://click.egroups.com/1/3120/7/_/451022/_/955681130/ ...
ygData.messageBody:
Sure, after all, casters all have meditate so why do
they need your song?



--- "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
wrote:
> Argument number one has been covered pretty well
> here, but will likely be
> ignored. Argument number two, remove Mana song from
> your play list
> permanently. See how they like that.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Jeff Heskett [mailto:tarkin@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 9:09 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] ugh, shutting bards out of lotto
> getting more
> widespread
>
>
> tonight i found out that no longer will bards in our
> guild be allowed on
> lotto for haste items, ever. (unless it's bard-only)
>
> 2 cloak of flames dropped off nagafen last time (i
> wasn't there or i
> would've known about this sooner) and bards were
> excluded in the lotto. no
> more runed bolster belts will be going to bards
> either. (fbss only likely
> one now, and only then if no other guild members
> that need it are in group
> according to guild rules)
>
> i need some pursuasive arguments to back me up. this
> is a guild of 150+
> different players. (tho minus a few bards lately)
>
> i tried a few arguments mentioned on this list, but
> the leaders of the guild
> are pretty sure that since bards have haste songs,
> they don't need a haste
> item. (even tho they stack) being a huge guild, the
> leaders get whines and
> rants all the time, so our chances of convincing
> them otherwise is very
> slim.
>
> any ideas?
>
>
>
